    • Method Detail

      • writeBoolean

        public void writeBoolean(NativeProcess process,
                         int offset,
                         boolean value)
                  throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: MemoryWriter
        Writes an 8-bit boolean value to the specified offset. True will be written as a 1, and false as a 0.
        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface MemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - THe value to write to memory. True will write 1, false will write 0.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.

      • writeCharUTF8

        public void writeCharUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                          int offset,
                          char value)
                   throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: MemoryWriter
        Writes one 8-bit UTF-8 code unit to the specified offset.

        Notice that this method only writes one byte, so characters which are encoded into multiple bytes are not supported. If attempting to write characters higher than U+007F, this method will throw an exception. To write multi-byte characters, use MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String).

        Specified by:
        writeCharUTF8 in interface MemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        See Also:
        MemoryWriter.writeCharUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, char), MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String), MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

      • writeCharUTF16LE

        public void writeCharUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                             int offset,
                             char value)
                      throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: MemoryWriter
        Writes one 16-bit UTF-16 little endian code unit to the specified offset.

        Notice that this method only writes one 16-bit code unit, so characters which are encoded with two surrogate units are not supported. If attempting to write characters higher than U+FFFFF, this method will throw an exception. To write multiple code units, use MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

        Specified by:
        writeCharUTF16LE in interface MemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        See Also:
        MemoryWriter.writeCharUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, char), MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String), MemoryWriter.writeStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, java.lang.String)

      • writeStringUTF8

        public void writeStringUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                            int offset,
                            java.lang.String value)
                     throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: MemoryWriter
        Writes an UTF-8 encoded string to the specified offset.

        Notice that UTF-8 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+007F are encoded with two to four 8-bit code units. Users should be careful when writing characters which use multiple code units, as String.length() returns the amount of UTF-16 code units. Use String.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8) to retrieve the amount of bytes written by this method.

        Specified by:
        writeStringUTF8 in interface MemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.

      • writeStringUTF16LE

        public void writeStringUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                               int offset,
                               java.lang.String value)
                        throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: MemoryWriter
        Writes an UTF-16 little-endian encoded string to the specified offset.

        Notice that UTF-16 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+FFFF are encoded with two 16-bit surrogate code units. Users should be careful when writing characters which use multiple code units, as String.length() returns the amount of 16-bit UTF-16 code units. Use String.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_16LE) to retrieve the amount of bytes written by this method.

        Specified by:
        writeStringUTF16LE in interface MemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to write to.
        offset - The memory address offset to write to.
        value - The value to write to memory.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
